medical_history.chief_complaint: Development of painful meningo-radiculitis and myositis due to Lyme borreliosis after allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Eighteen days prior to admission, the patient noted fever (temperature, 38.6Â°C) and was treated with levofloxacin. Six days later, he developed sudden onset excruciating lower-back pain radiating to both legs and pain between his shoulder blades. One day prior to admission, he developed progressive proximal leg weakness without bowel or bladder symptoms. The patient's back pain resolved after 4 days of ceftriaxone treatment. However, weakness progressed and he was nearly plegic in both legs, while arm strength remained at 4/5.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia in remission after receiving a non-myeloablative allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant 2 years prior; chronic graft-versus-host disease requiring ongoing immunosuppression; hypothyroidism; type II diabetes mellitus; recurrent sinusitis; hypogammaglobulinemia treated with intravenous immunoglobulin supplementation every other month.
medical_history.social_history: The patient attributed resolving papular lesions on arms and legs to insect bites from a recent wild turkey-hunting trip in south central Maine.
